column4: left
column6: left
column7: left

column4: Description
column6: Test Steps
column7: Expected Results

column4: Verify GCP Organization exists with correct domain and billing account association
column6: 1. Login to GCP console; 2. Navigate to IAM & Admin > Resource Manager; 3. Verify Organization with domain; 4. Check billing account association
column7: Organization accessible with correct domain and billing account linked

column4: Verify folder structure matches design with dev staging prod and shared-services
column6: 1. Navigate to Resource Manager; 2. Expand Organization hierarchy; 3. Verify four folders exist; 4. Check folder names match design
column7: Four folders visible under Organization with correct names

column4: Verify projects can be created within designated folders
column6: 1. Navigate to target folder; 2. Create new project; 3. Verify project appears in folder; 4. Check billing account linked
column7: Project created successfully in specified folder

column4: Verify SAML SSO authentication works with corporate identity provider
column6: 1. Navigate to GCP console; 2. Attempt login with SSO; 3. Verify redirect to IdP; 4. Complete authentication; 5. Confirm GCP access
column7: Users can authenticate via corporate IdP with single sign-on

column4: Verify GCDS syncs users and groups from Active Directory
column6: 1. Check GCDS sync status; 2. Verify users appear in Cloud Identity; 3. Confirm group memberships; 4. Validate email attributes
column7: Users and groups appear in Cloud Identity within sync interval

column4: Verify IAM roles correctly assigned at org folder and project levels
column6: 1. Check organization IAM; 2. Verify folder-level roles; 3. Test project-level permissions; 4. Validate role inheritance
column7: Users have expected permissions based on role assignments

column4: Verify 2SV is required for all administrator accounts
column6: 1. Attempt admin login without 2SV; 2. Verify enrollment prompt; 3. Complete 2SV setup; 4. Test subsequent login
column7: Admin login requires 2SV and non-compliant users blocked

column4: Verify Shared VPC host project is configured correctly
column6: 1. Navigate to VPC networks; 2. Check Shared VPC status; 3. Verify APIs enabled; 4. Confirm host project designation
column7: Host project shows as Shared VPC host with all APIs enabled

column4: Verify all subnets created with correct CIDR ranges and settings
column6: 1. List all subnets in VPC; 2. Verify CIDR ranges match design; 3. Check Private Google Access; 4. Confirm regions correct
column7: 12 subnets visible across 3 regions with correct CIDRs

column4: Verify service projects can attach to Shared VPC
column6: 1. Create service project; 2. Attach to Shared VPC; 3. Verify attachment status; 4. Test subnet access
column7: Service project successfully attached to Shared VPC

column4: Verify Private Google Access enabled on all subnets
column6: 1. Create VM without external IP; 2. Attempt to access Google APIs; 3. Verify connectivity; 4. Check DNS resolution
column7: VMs without external IPs can access Google APIs

column4: Verify Cloud NAT provides internet egress for private VMs
column5: Cloud NAT configured in each region
column6: 1. Create VM without external IP; 2. Attempt internet access; 3. Verify NAT translation; 4. Check NAT logs
column7: VMs without external IPs can reach internet via NAT gateway

column4: Verify firewall rules allow internal traffic and block unauthorized
column6: 1. Test internal VM-to-VM connectivity; 2. Test blocked external access; 3. Verify rule logging; 4. Check rule priority
column7: Internal traffic allowed and external traffic blocked per rules

column4: Verify Dedicated Interconnect is provisioned and active
column6: 1. Navigate to Hybrid Connectivity; 2. Check Interconnect status; 3. Verify link operational; 4. Confirm bandwidth
column7: Interconnect shows ACTIVE state in console with 10 Gbps

column4: Verify all 4 VLAN attachments are operational
column6: 1. List VLAN attachments; 2. Verify each attachment status; 3. Check bandwidth allocation; 4. Confirm router association
column7: 4 VLAN attachments show ACTIVE with correct bandwidth

column4: Verify BGP sessions established with on-premises routers
column6: 1. Check Cloud Router status; 2. Verify BGP peer state; 3. Confirm route exchange; 4. Test failover
column7: BGP sessions show ESTABLISHED state with route exchange

column4: Verify GCP routes advertised to on-premises network
column6: 1. Check advertised routes; 2. Verify on-prem routing table; 3. Test connectivity; 4. Validate path selection
column7: On-prem routers receive GCP subnet routes correctly

column4: Verify Security Command Center Premium is enabled organization-wide
column6: 1. Navigate to Security Command Center; 2. Verify Premium tier; 3. Check all features available; 4. Confirm scope
column7: SCC Premium active with all features available organization-wide

column4: Verify SCC discovers all GCP resources
column6: 1. Navigate to SCC Assets; 2. Filter by project; 3. Verify resource inventory; 4. Check asset types
column7: All projects and resources visible in SCC inventory

column4: Verify Chronicle receives logs from Cloud Audit Logs
column5: Chronicle configured and log sink created
column6: 1. Login to Chronicle console; 2. Search for recent GCP logs; 3. Verify log types; 4. Check ingestion latency
column7: Audit logs visible in Chronicle within 5 minutes of generation

column4: Verify organization policies block non-compliant resources
column6: 1. Attempt to create VM with external IP; 2. Verify policy denial; 3. Check error message; 4. Test other constraints
column7: Attempt to create non-compliant resource fails with policy error

column4: Verify Cloud KMS keys created and accessible
column6: 1. Navigate to KMS; 2. Verify key ring exists; 3. Check 6 keys present; 4. Confirm rotation schedule
column7: 6 keys visible in key ring with 90-day rotation configured

column4: Verify Terraform state stored in Cloud Storage with versioning
column6: 1. Verify bucket exists; 2. Check versioning enabled; 3. Confirm encryption; 4. Test terraform init
column7: Terraform init succeeds and state file visible in bucket

column4: Verify project factory module provisions complete project
column6: 1. Run terraform apply for new project; 2. Verify project created; 3. Check VPC attachment; 4. Confirm IAM and APIs
column7: New project created with VPC attachment IAM and APIs enabled

column4: Verify Cloud Build pipeline executes Terraform successfully
column6: 1. Trigger Cloud Build; 2. Monitor execution; 3. Verify terraform plan; 4. Confirm terraform apply
column7: Pipeline completes terraform plan and apply without errors

column4: Verify organization log sink exports to BigQuery
column6: 1. Check log sink status; 2. Query BigQuery dataset; 3. Verify log records; 4. Check export latency
column7: Audit logs appear in BigQuery dataset within 5 minutes

column4: Verify VPC Flow Logs capture network traffic in production
column5: Flow logs enabled on prod subnets
column6: 1. Generate network traffic; 2. Query Cloud Logging; 3. Verify flow log entries; 4. Check sampling rate
column7: Network traffic visible in Cloud Logging within 1 minute

column4: Verify monitoring dashboards display platform metrics
column6: 1. Navigate to Cloud Monitoring; 2. Open each dashboard; 3. Verify widgets populated; 4. Check data freshness
column7: 4 dashboards visible with real-time metric data

column4: Verify alert policies trigger notifications correctly
column6: 1. Simulate alert condition; 2. Verify alert fired; 3. Check notification channel; 4. Confirm alert content
column7: Test alert triggers notification to configured channels

column4: left
column6: left
column7: left

column4: Description
column6: Test Steps
column7: Expected Results

column4: Verify project provisioning completes within target time
column6: 1. Start timer; 2. Run terraform apply for new project; 3. Verify all resources created; 4. Stop timer; 5. Record duration
column7: New project fully operational within 60 minutes

column4: Verify Interconnect latency meets less than 5ms target
column6: 1. Create VM in GCP; 2. Run ping from on-prem to VM; 3. Record RTT; 4. Test multiple times; 5. Calculate average
column7: Ping from on-prem to GCP VM shows less than 5ms average RTT

column4: Verify Interconnect achieves expected throughput
column6: 1. Install iperf on both ends; 2. Run throughput test; 3. Record bandwidth; 4. Test bidirectional; 5. Verify consistency
column7: iperf test shows greater than 9 Gbps throughput sustained

column4: Verify Cloud NAT handles expected traffic volume
column6: 1. Create multiple VMs; 2. Generate concurrent outbound traffic; 3. Monitor NAT metrics; 4. Check for drops
column7: NAT gateway handles concurrent connections without drops

column4: Verify infrastructure passes CIS Google Cloud Foundation Benchmark
column6: 1. Run SCC CIS scan; 2. Review findings; 3. Check critical items; 4. Validate remediation; 5. Document exceptions
column7: SCC shows no critical CIS benchmark findings

column4: Verify security controls block common attack vectors
column6: 1. Attempt external port scan; 2. Test SQL injection on APIs; 3. Verify IAM escalation blocked; 4. Check network isolation
column7: Simulated attacks blocked by firewall policies and IAM

column4: Verify all data encrypted at rest with CMEK
column6: 1. Create storage bucket; 2. Verify CMEK encryption; 3. Check disk encryption; 4. Validate key usage
column7: Storage objects and disks show CMEK encryption applied

column4: Verify traffic fails over between VLAN attachments
column6: 1. Establish traffic flow; 2. Disable one attachment; 3. Verify traffic continues; 4. Check failover time; 5. Re-enable attachment
column7: Traffic continues during single attachment failure within 30 seconds

column4: Verify NAT continues during single gateway maintenance
column6: 1. Generate outbound traffic; 2. Simulate NAT maintenance; 3. Verify traffic continues; 4. Check for packet loss
column7: Outbound traffic continues during NAT maintenance

column4: Verify SOC 2 controls implemented and effective
column6: 1. Review SOC 2 control requirements; 2. Map to GCP controls; 3. Test control effectiveness; 4. Document evidence
column7: All SOC 2 control points documented and validated

column4: Verify PCI-DSS controls for network segmentation and encryption
column6: 1. Review PCI requirements; 2. Verify network segmentation; 3. Test encryption; 4. Validate access controls
column7: Network segmentation and encryption meet PCI requirements

column6: left
column7: left

column4: Description
column6: Test Steps
column7: Expected Results

column4: Verify pilot team 1 can access their provisioned project
column5: Pilot team 1 project created and IAM configured
column6: 1. Team member logs in; 2. Navigate to project; 3. Verify resource visibility; 4. Check permissions
column7: Team members can login and view project resources

column4: Verify pilot team 1 can deploy resources in their project
column6: 1. Create Compute Engine VM; 2. Create Cloud Storage bucket; 3. Deploy Cloud Run service; 4. Verify resources operational
column7: Team can create VMs storage and other resources successfully

column4: Verify pilot team workloads have network connectivity
column6: 1. Test VM-to-VM connectivity; 2. Test on-prem connectivity; 3. Test internet via NAT; 4. Verify DNS resolution
column7: VMs can reach other VMs and on-prem systems and internet via NAT

column4: Verify pilot team 2 can access their provisioned project
column5: Pilot team 2 project created and IAM configured
column6: 1. Team member logs in; 2. Navigate to project; 3. Verify resource visibility; 4. Check permissions
column7: Team members can login and view project resources

column4: Verify pilot team 2 can deploy resources in their project
column6: 1. Create Compute Engine VM; 2. Create Cloud Storage bucket; 3. Test GKE deployment; 4. Verify resources operational
column7: Team can create VMs storage and container resources successfully

column4: Verify platform team can provision new projects via Terraform
column6: 1. Clone Terraform repository; 2. Create tfvars for new project; 3. Run terraform apply; 4. Verify project created
column7: Platform admin can request and provision new project independently

column4: Verify security team can investigate SCC findings
column6: 1. Login to SCC; 2. Navigate to Findings; 3. Select finding; 4. Review details; 5. Mark as remediated
column7: Security admin can view investigate and remediate findings

column4: Verify FinOps team can access cost dashboards
column6: 1. Login with FinOps account; 2. Navigate to billing; 3. View cost breakdown; 4. Check budget status
column7: FinOps can view cost data and budget status by project
